messages.subject: Re: [***SPAM*** Score/Req: 24.8/15.0] Re: [nihontostudy] Tsuba with copper chips in the iron
messages.msgSnippet: Actually I don´t know what it is, is more like pink, like copper and silver or something like that, and I can also see it under the brown patina. I´ll try to
messages.messageBody:
Actually I don´t know what it is, is more like pink, like copper and silver
or something like that, and I can also see it under the brown patina.
I´ll try to get better pics.
What I must to do with the active rust?
Thank you for your reply.
Máximo

Máximo D. Marchionni
www.maximom.com.ar
Maximo@...

Subject: [***SPAM*** Score/Req: 24.8/15.0] Re: [nihontostudy] Tsuba with
copper chips in the iron


That is a tool or knife I think Maximo, I forget it's name now. The
others circles I think are a variation of Udanuke-ana.

I do not think i would not call that tekkotsu. Are you sure it is copper
?, there is a lot of active rust on that guard.

Rich

Maximo wrote:
> Hello to every one, I have a tsuba with "tekkotsu" in copper, or something
> like that...., it is a sukashi tsuba with a hawk (I guess) in negative,
and
> a few stones (guessing too) but it has a few copper chips in the iron,
> (looks like koi skin).
> I want to know if some one saw this thing on a tsuba before and if is it
> traditional?
> Thanks for the band width.
> Thank you in advance,
